Package com.buralotech.oss.jcrunit

Class JCRRepositoryRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • com.buralotech.oss.jcrunit.JCRRepositoryRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule
    public final class JCRRepositoryRule
extends org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
    A JUnit Rule to help test applications that use the Java Content Repository API. This rule creates an in-memory content repository using Jackrabbit Oak.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Brian Matthews

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private javax.jcr.Credentials credentials
      The credentials used to authenticate when connecting to the repository.

      void after()
      Invoked by JUnit after test case has completed and is responsible for resetting the rule allowing the in-memory JCR repository to be garbage collected.

                                    javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Create a file in the repository.
        Parameters:

        type - The content type of the file.
        encoding - The content encoding of the file.
        data - The binary content of the file.
        Returns:
        A reference to this to allow fluent-style chaining of invocations.
        Throws:
        IOException

        public JCRRepositoryRule createFile​(String path,
                                    String name,
                                    String type,
                                    String encoding,
                                    InputStream inputStream)
                             throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException

        Parameters:
        path - The fully qualified path of the parent folder.
        name - The name of the file to be created.
        type - The content type of the file.
        encoding - The content encoding of the file.
        inputStream - The input stream that provides the binary content of the file.
        Returns:
        A reference to this to allow fluent-style chaining of invocations.

      • importFromXML

        public JCRRepositoryRule importFromXML​(String path)
                                throws IOException,
                                       javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Import file and folder nodes into the repository with from an XML resource on the class path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the XML resource on the class path.
        Returns:
        A reference to this to allow fluent-style chaining of invocations.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was a problem reading the XML resource.
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - If there was a problem importing the XML resource.

      • importFromXML

        public JCRRepositoryRule importFromXML​(InputStream inputStream)
                                throws IOException,
                                       javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Import file and folder nodes into the repository with from an XML resource loaded from an input stream.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input stream from which the XML resource can be loaded.
        Returns:
        A reference to this to allow fluent-style chaining of invocations.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was a problem reading the XML resource.
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - If there was a problem importing the XML resource.

      • importFromXML

        public JCRRepositoryRule importFromXML​(javax.jcr.Credentials credentials,
                                       InputStream inputStream)
                                throws IOException,
                                       javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Import file and folder nodes into the repository with from an XML resource loaded from an input stream using the specified credentials.
        Parameters:
        credentials - The credentials to use for the operation.
        inputStream - The input stream from which the XML resource can be loaded.
        Returns:
        A reference to this to allow fluent-style chaining of invocations.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was a problem reading the XML resource.
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - If there was a problem importing the XML resource.
